translation.en: [announcer] Ladies and gentlemen,
welcome to Beyoncé Homecoming 2018.
[crowd] Beychella! Beychella! Beychella!
[crowd chanting] Beyoncé! Beyoncé! Beyoncé!
Beyoncé! Beyoncé! Beyoncé!
Beyoncé! Beyoncé! Beyoncé!
-Coachella. You ready? -[crowd cheers]
[Beyoncé] Let's go get 'em.
Coachella, y'all dance with me. Come on. Hey!
[Nina Simone] I think what you're trying to ask is, uh,
why am I so insistent upon...
giving out to them that Blackness,
that Black Power, that Black-- Pushing them to identify
with, uh, Black culture.
I think that is what you're asking.
I have no choice over it in the first place.
To me, we are the most beautiful creatures in the whole world; Black people.
translation.ko: 제겐 흑인이 가장 아름다운 존재인 거 같아요

translation.en: My job is to somehow make them curious enough, or persuade them,
translation.ko: 제 역할은 흑인들이 그들의 존재와 출신을 생각하고

translation.en: by hook or crook, to get more aware of themselves and where they came from
translation.ko: 우리에게 주어졌던 삶과 세상에 대해 어떻게든

translation.en: and what they are into, and what is already there and just to bring it out.
translation.ko: 호기심을 가지고 답을 찾아가도록 인도하는 겁니다

translation.en: This is what compels me to compel them.
And I will do it by whatever means necessary.
Which one do you think is better?
translation.ko: 어떤 게 더 나은 거 같아?

translation.en: [man] I mean, I think we could use another music run-through...
[man] And get all the departments because...
the people who haven't seen the show, like seen the run-through over there,
are super unclear on what the vibe is.
translation.ko: 어떤 느낌인지 잘 모르는 거 같아

translation.en: -What this is. -[man] Yeah.
Agreed.
I'm with you. [man] People who have just saw it...
Then they got it. They just now getting it. Got it.
[Beyoncé] Okay, so can we see if it's a good time to do that?
[woman] They can be here til' eight.
-What time is it? -[woman] It's 6:30.
[man 2] Let's go.
-[woman 2] Go over there? -[woman 3] Yeah.
[Beyoncé] I grew up in Houston, Texas,
visiting Prairie View.
We rehearsed at TSU
translation.ko: 서드 워드에 있는 텍사스 서던 대학교에서

translation.en: for many years in Third Ward,
and I always dreamed of going to an HBCU.
translation.ko: 역사적 흑인 대학에 가는 게 꿈이었지

translation.en: My college was Destiny's Child.
My college was traveling around the world, and life was my teacher.
translation.ko: 공연 투어가 내 수업이었고 인생이 선생님이었어

translation.en: I wanted a Black orchestra.
I wanted the steppers, I needed the vocalists.
I wanted different characters; I didn't want us all doing the same thing.
translation.ko: 개성이 강하고 다양한 사람들을 모으고 싶었지

translation.en: And the amount of swag is just limitless. Like...
the things that these young people can do
translation.ko: 이 어린 친구들이 가진 끼는 엄청나

translation.en: with their bodies, and the music they can play, and...
the drumrolls, and the haircuts, and the bodies, and the...
It's just not right.
It's just so much damn swag.
It's just gorgeous, and it makes me proud. And, um...
translation.ko: 감격할 만큼 아름다운 개성을 가지고 있지

translation.en: I wanted every person that has ever been dismissed because of the way they look
translation.ko: 외모 때문에 거절당한 이들이 다시 모여

translation.en: to feel like they were on that stage.
translation.ko: 무대에 함께 설 수 있길 바랐어

translation.en: Killing 'em. Killing 'em.
And I want this to be, uh...
an experience where we all have growth,
we all have to push ourselves and have to dig deep inside of ourselves
to become better human beings.
And I wanna start off with a prayer.
All right.
God, thank you so much for everyone here.
translation.ko: 하나님, 모두 함께 모이게 해주셔서 감사합니다

translation.en: Thank you for bringing all of these human beings into my life.
translation.ko: 제 인생에 이 사람들을 주셔서 감사합니다

translation.en: God, I ask that this is an experience that...
we all remember forever.
I ask that we're able to touch people and give them hope.
translation.ko: 사람들에게 감동을 주고 희망을 줄 수 있도록 해주세요

translation.en: To make people feel beautiful, strong...
and united.
God, I ask that you just use us.
I ask that we all grow, and we all connect.
And Lord, thank you so much for choosing us.
Thank you for bringing everyone here into my life.
translation.ko: 이 사람들을 알게 해 주셔서 감사합니다

translation.en: We give you all the praise and glory, amen.
[company] Amen.
[Beyoncé] So, I want us to have fun and just, we have so much to learn.
translation.ko: 서로 즐기면서 많은 걸 배웠으면 좋겠어요

translation.en: 'Cause we're here to rehearse,
and eventually we'll get on that stage and just let it all go,
translation.ko: 나중에 무대에 올라가서 모든 걸 다 발산해서

translation.en: and feel the spirit and have us a good time.
But, right now, it's still janky,
and we got so much to learn and work out.
translation.ko: 배울 것도 많고 연습할 것도 많아요

translation.en: So I wanted us to feel each other's energy,
and dance, and scream, and holler, and hoot.
Do whatever we feel naturally.
And we're gonna build this thing together.
So let's just do it.
Let me hear you sing.
Bug a Boos.
I need a good laugh.
You.
Make me laugh.
Bug a Boos!
We got you, right?
Did that make us laugh?
[group and crowd] No!
Think about it.
Bug a Boos!
Fall in line.
Ladies.
Ladies.
Ladies.
Are we smart?
[audience] Yes!
Are we strong?
[audience]Yes!
Have we had enough of the bullshit?
Show me.
Suck on my balls!
Suck on my balls, bitch! Suck...
On my balls!
Suck on my balls, pause!
I see you. How did you do that so fast? She has on my outfit, y'all.
translation.ko: 거기! 어떻게 벌써 입수했죠? 내 의상을 다 갖고 있다니까

translation.en: Sing it, ladies.
Right, ladies?
[Beyoncé] Yes.
Coachella!
Thank y'all so much for having us once again.
I'm so honored to be on this stage tonight.
translation.ko: 이 무대에 설 수 있어 영광입니다

translation.en: This next song is for all of my queens.
Do we have any beautiful queens in the house tonight?
I want y'all to sing along if you know the lyrics.
It's called "Bow Down."
Listen.
[Beyoncé] Do one more!
[Beyoncé] When I decided to do Coachella,
instead of me pulling out my flower crown,
it was more important that I brought our culture to Coachella.
[Beyoncé] There was a four-month period of rehearsals
with Derek and the band before we started
the four months of dance rehearsals.
The music and those vocal rehearsals--
that's the heartbeat of the show.
I wanted all of these different characters,
and I wanted it to feel the way I felt
when I went to battle of the bands,
because I grew up seeing those shows, and that being the highlight of my year.
translation.ko: 난 밴드 공연을 보며 자랐고 잊을 수 없는 추억이거든

translation.en: [choreographer] Five, six, seven, go.
Five, swipe, right, left,
swipe, step, clap.
[Beyoncé] So I studied my history, I studied my past,
and I put every mistake,
all of my triumphs,
of my 22-year career
into my two-hour homecoming performance.
[man] Looking at what she wanted to bring to the community,
and caring about current events, and caring about what, you know, her people are going through,
translation.ko: 주위 사람들을 위해 세상에 일어나는 사건들을 위해

translation.en: and wanting to shed light,
and wanting to put, you know, a proud moment on stage for us,
translation.ko: 또 우리만의 무대로 자긍심을 주려는 노력을 보면

translation.en: it gives you a boost. It's like, "Wow!"
[man] They heard her say it without saying it.
"Let's get it together. Let's move forward, let's unify."
translation.ko: 그녀의 외침은 말하지 않아도 들렸어요 '함께 헤쳐나가자 함께 뭉치자'

translation.en: All of those things existed in this performance.
[Beyoncé] It felt like we were all connected,
and it literally felt like we were in our own university
and struggling together.
The hours were unbelievable.
[Beyoncé] We did a pass without any music.
And just to hear the energy in all the stops, and...
to feel the shaking of the risers on the pyramid,
to hear the harmonies live was just as entertaining.
Coachella, I wanna hear y'all sing.
How y'all doing over here?
I can see you all the way. All the way back there.
translation.ko: 뒤에 있는 여러분 모두 다 보여요

translation.en: Sing it, y'all!
Sing.
-[Beyoncé] Come on, sing! -[audience continues vocalizing]
-Sing. -[audience vocalizes]
-Sing it. -[audience vocalizes]
[Beyoncé] Sing it.
Say, "I'm-a a diva." Sing it.
-Say, "I'm-a a diva." Sing it. -[audience] ♪ I'm-a a diva ♪
-Louder. "I'm-a a diva." Louder. -[audience] ♪ I'm-a a diva ♪
Can't hear you. "I'm-a a diva." -Sing it. -[audience] ♪ I'm-a a diva ♪
Divas, y'all help me sing this next verse?
translation.ko: 다음 구절 부르는 거 도와줄 거죠?

translation.en: Here we go.
[Beyoncé] I was supposed to do Coachella the year prior.
But...
I got pregnant unexpectedly.
And it ended up being twins,
which was even more of a surprise.
My body went through more than I knew it could.
[Beyoncé] I was 218 pounds the day I gave birth.
I had an extremely difficult pregnancy.
I had high blood pressure,
I developed toxemia, preeclampsia,
and, in the womb,
one of my babies' heartbeat paused a few times,
so I had to get an emergency C-section.
[Toni Morrison] Home is something very peculiar.
There is a yearning in it, you know?
Something special, mystical, hopeful,
restful.
-Here we go.First combination. -[choreographer laughs]
translation.ko: 간다 "출산 후 첫 연습 날" 첫 동작

translation.en: -First... -[cheers] I been getting to.
That go:
I been getting to.
[Beyoncé] It's my first time back home,
on the stage, after giving birth.
I'm creating my own homecoming.
And it's hard.
There were days that I thought, you know, I'd never be the same.
translation.ko: 다시 예전처럼 할 수 없겠단 좌절도 있었어

translation.en: I'd never be the same physically, my strength and endurance would never be the same.
translation.ko: 신체나 기력, 인내력까지 예전 같지 않았지

translation.en: [man] Between SoulCycle and coming in here,
translation.ko: 실내 자전거 하고 여기까지 오는 것만

translation.en: -you're losing like 1,500-2,000 calories. -[Beyoncé] Calories, yeah.
It's true. And, eventually,
I wanna be able to do SoulCycle, the stairs, and rehearse in a day.
translation.ko: 하루에 실내 자전거 계단, 리허설까지 다 할 거야

translation.en: [man] Okay. Lit. I'll be right there with you.
[Beyoncé] And you know, a lot of the choreography
is about feeling, so it's not as technical.
It's your own personality that brings it to life.
And that's hard when you don't feel like yourself.
translation.ko: 내 몸이 예전 같지 않아서 그게 더 어려웠어

translation.en: I had to rebuild my body
from cut muscles.
It took me a while to feel confident enough to freak it,
translation.ko: 자신감을 가지는 데 시간이 꽤 걸렸어

translation.en: and give it my own personality.
[Beyoncé] In the beginning, it was so many muscle spasms.
Just, internally, my body was not connected.
My mind was not there.
My mind wanted to be with my children.
What people don't see is the sacrifice.
I would dance, and go off to the trailer,
and breastfeed the babies,
and the days I could, I would bring the children.
Like, it gets messy.
Like, it's this-- I'm not even joking, this fast.
Yes.
-[man] It's doable, but... -It's fast.
-[Beyoncé] This is grounding. -[woman] Yes.
[Beyoncé] Like, no matter who you are,
-you get in here, and it's real. -[man] Uh-huh.
-[Beyoncé] Yeah. -[Beyoncé and man laugh]
[man] That's what people don't get. That's why--
[Beyoncé] That's why people don't like to rehearse.
-You gotta be humble. -[man] Uh-huh.
[Beyoncé] You gotta be willing to look awkward, and...
-you gotta study, be a student. -[man laughs]
[panting] I might...
pass out! [laughs]
Five, six. Five, six, let's go.
[Beyoncé] In order for me to meet my goal,
I'm limiting myself to no bread, no carbs,
no sugar, no dairy,
no meat, no fish, no alcohol.
[sighs] And I'm hungry.
Just trying to figure out how to balance being a mother of a six-year-old
and of twins that need me
translation.ko: 6살 아이와 쌍둥이의 엄마이면서 나의 창의성을 만들어나가는 아티스트

translation.en: and giving myself creatively
and, um, physically. It was a lot to juggle.
It's not like before, when I could rehearse,
translation.ko: 예전에는 15시간 쉬지 않고 연습할 수 있었는데

translation.en: you know, 15 hours straight.
I have children, I have a husband. I have to take care of my body.
translation.ko: 이젠 아이와 남편이 있고 내 몸도 돌봐야 해

translation.en: There she is.
Hi, my babies!
Hi, Baba! Hi, baby!
Hi, this is me!
[Beyoncé] I definitely pushed myself further than I knew I could.
And I've learned a very valuable lesson--
I will never... [laughs]
...never push myself that far again.
I feel like I'm just a new--
A new woman, in a new chapter of my life,
and I'm not even trying to be who I was.
It's just so beautiful that children...
do that to you.
-You have to get three turns. -[woman] Okay, best out of three.
Okay, this is seriously a huge accomplishment.
Because I did not think I'd ever get back in my old costume,
translation.ko: 이 무대의상을 다시는 못 입을 줄 알았는데

translation.en: and I'm actually in it.
And I can still move...
I still have a ways to go, but this makes me feel good,
translation.ko: 아직 더 빼야 하지만 기분이 좋네요

translation.en: 'cause I've been sacrificing and working hard.
-Huge, huge, huge accomplishment. Yay! -[man] Ooh!
[man] Are you going to wear it for rehearsals? -No, I'm not! -[man] Okay.
[woman] You're gonna go out to dinner in it?
translation.ko: - 그거 입고 저녁 먹을 거야? - 좋지

translation.en: [Beyoncé] Although, I do wanna tell-- go show Jay. It's a big deal.
[woman] Why don't you take a walk across the-- [Beyoncé] I ain't walking there. Doing too much.
translation.ko: - 바로 길 건너에 있어 - 걷기 싫어

translation.en: [man] Hi. Can we talk to Mr. Carter, please?
[woman on phone] Of course.
-[Jay] Yup. -I'm back in my costume.
All right!
Big deal!
-All right! -It's zipped.
[Beyoncé] All right. Just had to share.
[woman] Why aren't guys as excited?
Twins, tell 'em.
How are y'all feeling?
Coachella.
How did you wake up this morning?
All right. I want y'all to repeat after me.
Say it.
[DJ Khalid] Check this out. After Beyoncé perform,
after she done the decks,
Coachella gotta rename Coachella to Beychella.
New name alert: Beychella.
Y'all know this one, I want y'all to sing along.
translation.ko: 이 노래 다 알죠? 같이 불러요

translation.en: I'm Bug a Boo Daddy,
aka "Me, Myself..."
Yo, let's take a group pic, bro. Come on, come on.
"...and I." [laughs]
I'm Bug a Boo Up!
Also known as...
I'm Bug a--
[trills] I'm Bug a Boo "Sweet Dreams,"
also known as... [blows]
"...Blow."
I'm Bug a Boo "Disappear," also known as...
translation.ko: 난 사라지는 어흥 님 이런 게 내 전문이지

translation.en: I'm Bug a Boo "Rocket."
also known as...
I'm Bug a Boo ♪ We gotta work it out ♪
-[all] ♪ Hey ♪ -Also known as:
-Bug a Boos! Hey! -[all] All together now!
[woman] My name is Edidiong Emah. I am originally from Nigeria,
translation.ko: 에디디옹 에마입니다 나이지리아 출신이고 애틀랜타에서 자랐어요

translation.en: grew up in Atlanta, and...
this dream is something that I never could dream up for myself.
translation.ko: 이건 꿈도 꾸지 못했던 꿈의 무대예요

translation.en: I couldn't dream this big at all. I never thought I would be here,
translation.ko: 여기 참여할 거라곤 상상도 못 했어요

translation.en: thought I would be too short, too thick.
Actually, my whole family went to Morehouse and Spelman,
which are HBCUs in Atlanta.
So to do this and... to have, you know,
the Pan and, you know, sororities and things that...
Black families value
up on a stage for the world to see and understand us a little bit more...
translation.ko: 무대에서 세상에 보여주며 알리는 것 자체가

translation.en: It's just all a blessing.
I just toss it up,
and catch it in my spirit first, and then real life second.
translation.ko: 우선 직감으로 가져오고 현실에 적용하는 거죠

translation.en: [Tessa Thompson] In each of us,
another woman or a young girl might see a reflection of herself;
of her worth, of her boundless potential.
[Danai Gurira] The youth need to see their greatness reflected in our eyes.
translation.ko: 우리가 보는 여러분의 위대함을 깨달아야 합니다

translation.en: Go forth. Let them know we're real.
I waited 37 weeks...
to be here.
Being pregnant, so...
I didn't dance for a year.
Looking out there into that crowd, I was overwhelmed
and I feel so honored and so great
being a part of something so epic,
that my son can watch when he's older and...
identify with the people, identify with the culture.
And I'm just so honored to be a part of something
that he can watch, and be proud of me, and say,
translation.ko: 자랑스러워할 공연을 할 수 있어 행복해요

translation.en: "My mom was a part of that, my mom did that."
[Beyoncé] It's hard to believe that, after all these years,
I was the first African-American woman to headline Coachella.
translation.ko: 내가 최초의 흑인 여성 헤드라인이라는 것에 놀랐어

translation.en: It was important to me that everyone that had never seen themselves represented
felt like they were on that stage with us.
As a Black woman,
I used to feel like the world wanted me to stay in my little box.
translation.ko: 세상이 날 가두려고 한 걸 느꼈었어

translation.en: And Black women often feel underestimated.
I wanted us to be proud of not only the show, but... the process.
Proud of the struggle.
Thankful for the beauty that comes with a painful history
translation.ko: 쓰라린 역사 후에 남겨진 아름다움에 감사했고

translation.en: and rejoice in the pain.
Rejoice in the imperfections and the wrongs that are so damn right.
translation.ko: 불완전함과 맞지 않는 것을 즐기는 건 옳은 선택이었지

translation.en: And I wanted everyone to feel grateful for their curves,
their sass, their honesty,
thankful for their freedom.
It was no rules,
and we were able to create a free, safe space
where none of us were marginalized.
Are y'all ready, Coachella?
I wanna see everybody from the front to the back.
Put your hand up.
Sing it now, hey! Hey! Hey!
Here we go!
[man] Three, two, one!
I gotta go home.
-To my fifty-'leven children. -[people laugh]
[Beyoncé] I know I gotta go home.
-[man laughs] -[Beyoncé] He's looking at me like, "You too lit to quit, it's time to go." [laughs]
[woman] He's like, "You do need to quit, ma'am."
Just for shits and giggles, could you do this one, too?
translation.ko: - '그만 좀 해' 표정인데 - 혹시 심심하면 이것도 해줄래?

translation.en: [man] You know, yeah. There you go.
-[woman] That's what-- All right, I'm set. -[Beyoncé] Too lit.
[Beyoncé] You know, I respect things that take work.
I respect things that are built from the ground up.
translation.ko: 무에서 유를 창조하는 건 대단한 일이야

translation.en: You know, I'm super specific about every detail.
translation.ko: 난 작은 것까지 꼼꼼하게 보는 성향이 있어

translation.en: I personally selected each dancer,
every light, the material on the steps,
the height of the pyramid, the shape of the pyramid,
every patch was hand sewn.
translation.ko: 무대의상에 쓰이는 천과 엔딩곡까지 모두 골랐어

translation.en: Every tiny detail had an intention.
translation.ko: 작은 디테일까지 모두 의미가 담겨 있지

translation.en: There were so many meetings with Olivier...
translation.ko: 의상 디자이너 올리비에가 로스앤젤레스에 오기 전까지

translation.en: before he flew to Los Angeles
so we could understand, "Okay, why do we want these colors?
translation.ko: 왜 이 색상을 선택하고 의미하는 바가 무엇인지

translation.en: What do they represent?
What is the silhouette?
What is gonna look the most graphic? How do we look united?
translation.ko: 어떻게 하면 생생하게 그리고 연합되어 보일까

translation.en: But how do we have these different characters that stand out?"
It took months for us to script the show.
translation.ko: 공연의 스크립트를 짜는 데 몇 달이 걸렸어

translation.en: When you spend so many months on choreography and arrangements,
and when there are over 200 people on the stage,
you want to make sure you see everything,
and I was very adamant
that we were well rehearsed and we knew the show
front to back.
It was a lot of Steadicam,
and we did things that were very unconventional for a festival show.
translation.ko: 축제 공연에서는 시도해보지 않던 것도 했지

translation.en: I had three soundstages.
There was one soundstage for the band,
there was one soundstage for dancing,
and there was one soundstage for my creative staff.
And I would go from one to the next.
It takes a huge team, it takes...
a village,
and I think we all worked to our limit.
In the rehearsals, I am...
directing and watching the show.
translation.ko: 무대 감독을 하며 리허설을 볼 수 있어

translation.en: I'm in the audience and I'm able to be on the stage
and kind of see the stage at the same time.
After every run-through there's a meeting
with, you know, at least 50 people, all of the department heads.
[Beyoncé] Not only does Derek have to record the choir,
he has to record the rumble of the structure, the stomps.
He has to record everybody's, "Hey! Ah!"
translation.ko: 모두가 '에, 아'하며 지르는 소리까지 녹음해야 해요

translation.en: And that adds another element of the performance
translation.ko: 공연을 더 생동감 있게 꾸밀 수 있죠

translation.en: that feels so good on the stage,
and it's not translating on film.
Until I see some of my notes applied,
it doesn't make sense for me to make more.
[Beyoncé] And it doesn't matter how many months we've done it,
how many times we've done it.
There are notes every time,
because there's always something that we can improve upon.
[Beyoncé] Just standing up there, and seeing all the beauty up there,
translation.ko: 무대 위에 서서 아름답게 다 뽐내며

translation.en: and feeling it--
It is the only way I can articulate why I'm frustrated,
because it's not translating on camera.
So my goal is simply that.
Like, it's just so everyone out there can feel what we feel.
translation.ko: 우리가 무대에서 즐기는 만큼 보는 모두가 즐기도록 하는 거예요

translation.en: [Beyoncé] And I really have to have dedicated people that are... down for the cause.
[Beyoncé] Whatever it is, let us know what we can prioritize,
to try to facilitate everybody's needs
so we can be done with having to talk so much.
translation.ko: 반복적으로 말할 필요 없이 잘 끝내봅시다

translation.en: That's where I am.
It's-- We're halfway there.
We just gotta make progress faster, because we're running out of time.
translation.ko: 이제 시간이 없으니 더 빨리 움직여야 해요

translation.en: Thank you, everybody.
Thank y'all.
I know everybody's working hard, so we'll get there.
translation.ko: 다들 열심히 하는 거 알아요 해낼 거예요

translation.en: -[man] All right, have a good anniversary. -[Beyoncé] Good night.
It's my anniversary.
[woman] Happy anniversary.
Okay, guys.
[Beyoncé] Sing it loud!
[Beyoncé] So, if you know this dance... I want you to do it.
Here we go!
I'm talking to you.
I see y'all in the front row.
Sing it, y'all!
Sing it, y'all.
I see you.
Can I take this back?
Sing it, y'all.
I wanna see y'all do the dance.
You ready?
I'm watching.
Let's see if you know it.
[male singers] ♪ Ten, nine ♪
♪ Eight, seven ♪
♪ Six, five ♪
♪ Four ♪
♪ Three, two, one ♪
[Jay-Z] Coachella, if you're having a good time tonight
make some noise!
[Beyoncé] Give it up for Hova. Hey!
Here we go!
[man] Question, everybody.
Anybody go to a HBCU?
-[woman 1] Hey! -[woman 2] Yes.
Don't you remember--?
[man] All the HBCU people make some noise!
[man] If you tried to go to college, make some noise.
Okay, okay.
If you dropped out of high school, make some noise!
-[small group cheers] -[man] Oh, shit.
[Prof. Cornell West] "Keep on pushing," Curtis Mayfield said.
"Be a force for good," Coltrane said.
"Mississippi Goddam," says Nina Simone.
That ain't having hope.
That's being a hope.
Courageously bearing witness, regardless of what the circumstances is
translation.ko: 환경이 어떻든 용기를 가지고 직시하라는 거죠

translation.en: because you're choosing to be a kind of person of integrity
translation.ko: 신의를 가지고 자신을 최고로 만들기 위해

translation.en: to the best of your ability before the worms get your body.
Boom.
[Beyoncé] I know the importance of us feeling we're a part of something,
like we're being spoken to, like it's worth it.
translation.ko: 가치 있는 것을 위해 달린다는 걸 알아야 해

translation.en: We all performed with all of our heart, and...
we performed with love and connection, and...
we did it together.
I love all of the people that were involved.
[man] Homecoming for an HBCU is...
the Super Bowl.
It is the Coachella.
You got all your people coming back that you haven't seen for however long.
translation.ko: 오랫동안 못 본 사람들이 함께 모여요

translation.en: You got all this tradition,
you got all these eyeballs wanting to see
if it's gonna be better than the last homecoming.
All those elements are right here.
[woman] We have the Black National Anthem that happens after "Freedom."
Message in particular is just a very powerful, very strong message.
Very inclusive.
But it really makes you proud to be African-American.
[man] I told my dad I joined a sorority.
He started dying,
'cause there's so many great sisters in there.
Great freestylers, of course,
and, you know, we a family. It feels like a college trip.
translation.ko: 가족 같아서 같이 놀러 가는 느낌이에요

translation.en: [in French] Be ready because we are going to put her on blast up there.
translation.ko: 우리가 비욘세를 무대에서 제대로 빛나게 해줄 거야

translation.en: we’re going to create shadows for this woman.
She's the best, and I only deal with number ones. Ya heard?
[man, in English] Move in on the side. Here we go. One, two...
[Beyoncé] Creating something that will live beyond me,
something that will make people feel open
and like they're watching magic,
like they're living in a time that's super special, and...
like it's a day that they will never relive.
translation.ko: 다시는 오지 않을 오늘을 감사하는 게

translation.en: That's what I want.
[man] Boy, look at that save!
[man] It has been a family environment. I love it.
I don't even wanna go home after it's over with.
[Beyoncé] If you know me, you know my family is...
the biggest priority in my life.
My family is my sanctuary,
my weakness and my strength.
They're my tribe, and it was important
translation.ko: 우린 같은 부족이니 모두 가족처럼 느끼는 게 중요했어요

translation.en: that we all felt like family.
It just was a dream come true
and something I feel like I've worked my entire life for.
translation.ko: 마치 오늘을 위해 인생을 건 것처럼요

translation.en: And I'm so grateful that I was able to come home.
[man] We got snares, cymbals, quads, and bass.
translation.ko: 스네어 드럼, 심벌즈, 테너 드럼 베이스 드럼, 다 모였습니다

translation.en: It's time for you to get a little taste
of the only drum line
certified by the Queen Bey,
guaranteed to show up and show out,
on your ass, anytime, anyplace, anywhere.
Introducing The Bzzzz.
Coachella, thank you for allowing me
to be the first Black woman to headline Coachella.
Ain't that 'bout a bitch?
This song is dedicated to all the incredible women
that opened up the doors for me.
Thank you so much, ladies.
Do we have any strong women out there tonight?
-Sing along! -["Run The World" plays]
Here we go!
[Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie] We teach girls to shrink themselves, to make themselves smaller.
translation.ko: 여자아이들에게 작은 세상에 맞춰 살라고 가르칩니다

translation.en: We say to girls, "You can have ambition, but not too much."
You should aim to be successful, but not too successful,
translation.ko: '성공을 목표로 하되 너무 성공해서도 안 돼'

translation.en: otherwise, you will threaten the man.
We raise girls to see each other as competitors.
Not for jobs or for accomplishments, but for the attention of men.
Feminist:
a person who believes in the social, political,
and economic equality of the sexes.
Everybody, give it up for the beautiful Kelly.
-And the beautiful Michelle. -We love you.
My girl B is killing it tonight!
I'm so happy y'all are here tonight.
Do y'all remember this song?
-♪ If you ain't running game ♪ -[Beyoncé]Sing it, y'all.
Sing it, y'all!
Let's go!
Please give it up for Destiny's Child!
Give it up one more time for my best friends!
That's my best friends.
Everybody say, "Hey, Mrs. Carter."
[audience] Hey, Mrs. Carter.
[Beyoncé] I'm just checking to make sure y'all still out there.
All the way in the back say, "Hey, Mrs. Carter."

translation.en: [audience] Hey, Mrs. Carter!
To my right say, "Hey, Mrs. Carter."
[audience] Hey, Mrs. Carter!
To my left say, "Hey, Mrs. Carter."
[audience] Hey, Mrs. Carter!
[Beyoncé] Everybody put your hands together like this.
Everybody put your hands together.
Yeah.
Now everybody say,
"Hey." [Beyoncé and audience chanting] Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey.
Even louder. "Hey, hey, hey."
Say, "I ain't worried, doin' me tonight." Sing.
[Beyoncé] Louder.
Yeah! Ladies and gentlemen,
please give it up for Solange!
Give it up for my sister!
All right, now.
Everybody put your hands together.
Do we have any single ladies in the house tonight?
-Now, wait. -[band stops]
I want y'all to get nice and stanky with me.
Where I'm from...
we do things nice and stanky.
We do things nice...
and funky.
Can y'all repeat after me? You ready?
Say, "Hey."
Now wait.
You still ain't stanking enough for me.
Sing.
♪ Don't be mad when you see That he want it ♪ I see you.
I love y'all.
Beautiful job, Baba.
-You sound so pretty! -I wanna do it again.
Oh, you wanna do it again? You're like Mommy, huh?
I wanna do that again.
-[Beyoncé laughs] Okay. -'Cause it feels good!
Okay. If you want to, go. Lift every voice and sing.
[Beyoncé] I feel we made something
that made my daughter proud.
Made my mother proud, my father proud,
I mean, and all of the people that are my brothers and sisters around the world,
and that's why I live.
I'm so lucky and grateful that I'm able to take all these crazy ideas
and actually make it into something that heals people
translation.ko: 사람들을 치료하고 비전을 가지도록 도와줄 수 있어

translation.en: and that may spark vision in people.
translation.ko: 사람들을 치료하고 비전을 가지도록 도와줄 수 있어 영광이었습니다

translation.en: That shows them to dream big,
that shows them that they are limitless.
It's possible.
If my country ass can do it, they can do it.
translation.ko: 저 같은 시골뜨기가 해냈으니 여러분도 할 수 있죠

translation.en: [Maya Angelou] That's nice. I've never been asked that question.
Joy. Brings me joy.
♪ Put a rainbow in the clouds ♪
I want to-- What I really want to do...
is be a representative of my race, of the human race.
I have a chance...
to show how kind we can be,
how intelligent and generous we can be.
I have a chance to-- to teach, and...
and to love, and to laugh, and--
I know that when I'm finished doing what I'm sent here to do,
I will be called home.
And I will go home without any fear
or trepidation,cause I'm wondering what's gonna happen.
[man] And...
what advice would you have to give this generation?
[Maya Angelou] Tell the truth.
To yourself first.
And to the children.
Live in the present.
Don't deny the past.
Live in the present and know the charge on you
is to make this country more than it is today.
translation.ko: 더 나은 나라를 만들 수 있단 걸 잊지 마세요

We love you.

Have a beautiful night. I love you from the bottom of my heart.

Boom. [laughs]

which is very ironic, as none of us are ever going home.
